basics.name: Kobey Arai
basics.label: Associate Software Development Engineer at Hawaiian Airlines
basics.summary: I am a Software Engineer who has extensive experience with Full Stack Web Development. I recieved my B.S. in Computer Science from the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii in Spring, 2023. With my skills, I strive to design, build, and improve products that benefit all users.

courses: ICS 312, Machine Level and Systems Programming
ICS 212, Program Structure in C and C++
ICS 211, Introduction to Computer Science II
ICS 111, Introduction to Computer Science I

work.company: Hawaiian Airlines Information Technology Digital Experience
work.summary: Worked on the Web Modernization Project, writing Single-Page-Applications (SPAs) for customers to interact with our airline. Used Angular, Bootstrap, and ngRx to build front-end user interfaces.

work.company: Hawaiian Airlines Information Technology Digital Experience
work.summary: Worked on the Web Modernization Project, writing Single-Page-Applications (SPAs) for customers to interact with our airline. Used Angular, Bootstrap, and ngRx to build front-end user interfaces. My Intern Project was to assist with rewriting the My Trips SPA found at https://mytrips.hawaiianairlines.com/. Performed work on the Itinerary page, flight-details page, guest-info pages, and configured routes and guards.

work.company: University of Hawaii System Information Technology Services
work.summary: Assists in the development of web applications for the University of Hawaii Information and Technology Services Identity and Access Management Team. Works on both AngularJS based front end and Java based back end.  Active participation in requesting features, fixing bug tickets, and working with university administrators to ensure proper function of apps. Was promoted to the current role of Branch Lead in September of 2021. In addition to previous responsibilities, now responsible for maintaining master branch codebase, approving and requesting feedback on pull requests. More information at https://www.test.hawaii.edu/uhgroupings/info

Teaches students concepts that are essential for their academic and professional career. As an undergraduate teaching assistant, I am responsible for holding office hours for students to attend when additional help is necessary, attending lectures to remain on the same page as the professor, hold recitations where I assist students in the completion of classwork and grade classwork and homework.

volunteer.summary: A part of a team that takes pride in the Mililani community. Active participation in service projects in Mililani, UH Manoa, and the Oahu community.
highlights: The focus areas of Lions are Environment, World Hunger, Diabetes, Childhood Cancer, Vision
Hosts and maintains www.mililanilions.org, which uses WordPress hosted on a Raspberry Pi
Former Treasurer (20-22), Secretary (22-23), and Community Service Chairperson (22-23)
Voted Lion of the Year in 2021, Received numerous leadership awards

volunteer.summary: I am a member of the Hawaii Lions District 50 Information Technology Committee which oversees all IT aspects of the Hawaii Lions orginization. IT needs include hawaiilions.org domain maintanance, the Hawaii Lions website, email, and other IT needs.
highlights: Maintains the hawaiilions.org website which uses Wordpress, Google Map API, and AWS Lightsail
System and Identity Access Management Administrator for member accounts such as Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Entra
Provides IT tech support to the Hawaii Lions
Provides IT Consulting to resolve issues to make our organization more efficient
Received the DG Gary IMUA coin from District Governer Gary Nip for going above and beyond the call of duty

volunteer.summary: The Association for Computing Machinery Manoa is the University of Hawaii at Manoa's chapter of the international learned society Association for Computing Machinery (ACM). There are more than 860 professional and student ACM chapters worldwide. ACM brings together computing educators, researchers, and professionals to inspire dialogue, share resources, and address the field's challenges. As the worldâ€™s largest computing society, ACM strengthens the profession's collective voice through strong leadership, promotion of the highest standards, and recognition of technical excellence. The Chapter consists of 1,000+ members ranging from Faculty, Staff, Students, and Alumni.
highlights: Brainstormed ideas for improving the productivity of the Chapter
Implement and manage software solutions that keep the Chapter efficient
Architected and Led a small team of web developers to create web applications including an attendance tracker which used React, Material UI, and Firebase
Coordinated the Spring 2023 UH Tech and Intelligence Career Fair which brought 175 students with Computer Science and Tech backgrounds together with 31 of Hawaii's top Tech Industry employers

volunteer.organization: Programming and Algorithms Special Interest Group
volunteer.summary: Programming and Algorithms is a special interest group within the larger Association for Computing Machinery Manoa organization
highlights: Solve problem sets in teams using algorithms at weekly meetings
In August of 2022, became an officer which allows me to mentor underclassmen on Algorithms. This also provides practice for gaining a better understanding of Algorithms.

awards.title: 2nd Place - Meteor Hackathon 2022
awards.summary: Out of 92 registered teams, my team placed second. We created a Web App using Meteor, React, Bootstrap, and the Google Maps API. The theme Making an Impact, our team sus-GAWKY created a gamified sustainability tracker that compares your progress with others in the community. In addition, the app will allow you to compare your community with other communities nearby to see how your community is doing in relation to others. Link to the Github repo: https://github.com/sus-gawky/sus-gawky

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester. The grades used for calculation of grade point average will be those earned by a date determined by the Office of the Registrar. Colleges also may establish independent criteria for the award of Dean's List distinction with the approval of the Vice Chancellor for Academic Affairs

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship for first-time degree seeking students. Students must have a 3.5 GPA, 1200 SAT or 23 ACT upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: STEM Honors
awards.summary: The STEM Honors Certificate is available for graduates who complete a STEM Capstone Project along with complete 4 years of Math, Science and hold a GPA of 3.0 or above
